911230979:
[

Assistant Director, Land Transport Market Reform

Company Name Department of Infrastructure, Regional Development and Cities Company Location Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 11 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are\xa0seeking\xa0high-performing, engaged and motivated Assistant Directors to work in the Land Transport Market Reform Branch.

\xa0

The Heavy Vehicle Charging Trials Section is responsible for delivering two significant initiatives:

The National Heavy Vehicle Charging Pilot is testing the replacement of registration fees and the heavy vehicle fuel charge with a mass-distance fee that more directly reflects heavy vehicles’ consumption of road services.

The Business Case Program for Location-Specific Heavy Vehicle Charging is testing industry’s willingness to pay an additional charge for a productivity benefit on a particular route (such as paying for a bridge upgrade to run longer, heavier trucks).

Both initiatives will help to ensure that road market reform is informed by real world evidence and the needs of road users.

The public-facing work of the Trials Section provides mechanisms for engaging stakeholders on broader reform questions. International experience suggests trials of road user charging are crucial in building stakeholder acceptance of changes to the way roads are paid for.

\xa0

National Pilot Policy Lead

As the Policy Lead of the National Pilot you will work with industry and international experts to develop policy settings for the technology and operational aspects of introducing direct user charging for heavy vehicles.

This combination of co-designing, testing, evaluating and refining policy is a rare opportunity for those with a keen interest in effective public policy development and implementation. You will be supported in this work by a multi-skilled team, both within the department and through external consultants.

This position will involve managing staff and collaborating across the Branch on reform directions and technical design issues. The position will also require travel to meet with stakeholders.

\xa0

Manager of the Business Case Program

The Program Manager’s main responsibility will be driving the development of business cases for location specific trials, in collaboration with industry stakeholders, state and territory agencies, and other experts.

This position will involve managing staff members and collaborating across the Branch on reform directions and technical design issues. The position will also require travel to meet with stakeholders

\xa0

Moreland City Council serves several inner northern suburbs of Melbourne and is one of the most culturally diverse municipalities in Victoria.

The Communications team is looking for an experienced communications professional to hit the ground running in a complex and fast-paced environment in the role of Marketing and Communications Officer.

The position is located at the Coburg Civic Centre, which is just 8km from the CBD and offers excellent public transport and cycling access for employees.

Reporting to the Senior Communications Coordinator, the Marketing and Communications Officer is responsible for creating a range of content across print and digital platforms, management of Moreland’s brand and the delivery of key Council publications.

The ideal candidate will have experience in a similar role within local government, working across all facets of marketing and communications, and will have a sound working knowledge of the end-to-end publication production process and proven copy writing, editing and proofreading skills.

Director Market Strategy & Partnering

Company Name Carter Murray Company Location Bathurst, New South Wales, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 11 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Tree change/return home for vastly improved standard of living
  • New role to help shape the future of a progressive academic institution
  • Senior leadership role, focussed on innovation and transformation


Charles Sturt University (CSU) is in a strong position to adapt to the fast-evolving educational landscape; being relatively new it is not bogged down in the shackles of tradition; it has a geographical footprint openly and proactively supported by government; and its faculties support learning and advancement in some of the fastest growing and important areas of business and community. What better time to make a tree change and join the forward thinking leadership team to play a pivotal role in its continuous evolution.


As Director of Market Strategy and Partnering you (and your team) will be tasked with driving the design and development of innovative market driven strategies, covering products, channels, partners and audiences. This will involve extensive research and market analysis both domestically and increasingly overseas. This will then drive programs of product and channel innovation and development that you will champion through the leadership of cross functional teams.


Whilst much of the collaboration needed to deliver successful outcomes will be internal, there is also a substantial requirement to identify and foster relationships with external third parties to enable the strategic growth this role is responsible for.\xa0


This is a high profile appointment within CSU and as such demands high calibre experience allied to a rare combination of interpersonal skills. First and foremost you will be able to demonstrate a strong track record of delivering innovative and commercially successful propositions from within a service based environment – though not necessarily education. You are a natural leader of people and take delight in their personal development as much as your own. You are a big picture thinker but are totally comfortable rolling up your sleeves when needed to, as your focus is on outcomes and results. Last but not least you know how to influence and inspire a diverse group of stakeholders even when their priorities may differ from your own.


In return we offer a fantastic culture fully underpinned by our values: insightful; inclusive; impactful; inspiring – values that could be written exclusively for a successful marketer. Quality of life and cost of living will be a considerable step up from the metro life you may currently enjoy/endure. But most of all you will get to make a difference – a real difference.


For more information or to apply please contact Andy Rouse at Carter Murray on andyrouse@cartermurray.com.au

Business Systems Administrator (Corporate)

Company Name Stadiums Queensland Company Location Brisbane, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 39 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Support of Technology One, Aurion and riteq systems
  • Contribute as an integral member of the Technology Services Group
  • Diverse and dynamic work environment

\xa0

The role:

\xa0

The Business Systems Administrator (Corporate) is required to provide systems administration and support services for SQ’s corporate business systems (including Finance and Human Resources). This includes the provision of business process and systems analysis, design and implementation activities to ensure business system functionality aligns with business operational requirements.


Key tasks include:

\xa0

  • Provide systems administration and support services for SQ’s corporate business systems (as outlined in Attachment A – Schedule of Technology Platforms and Standards).
  • Diagnose business systems faults and failures and initiate remedial action. Liaise with internal clients, technical support staff and external service providers, as required, to resolve problems.
  • Liaise with system owners, vendors and other team members in relation to the design, procurement, implementation and ongoing support of SQ’s corporate business systems.
  • Manage the corporate business system related aspects of system reporting, including the development and maintenance of queries, scripts and reports to meet the needs of the business.
  • Provide advice to system owners in relation to system operations, including internal controls and other corporate governance requirements, as well as future product directions.
  • Assist with the development of specifications, business cases and project plans to support the acquisition and deployment of business systems solutions.
  • Promote a culture of continuous improvement and contribute to the ongoing development of SQ’s corporate business systems in line with technology changes in the industry.
  • Service venue and client technical support requirements in a timely and efficient manner, providing on-site and on-call technical services for the organisation.
  • Develop and maintain quality documentation for each of the systems including user guides, operational procedures and architectural documentation and provide training to venue staff on the operation of key venue systems.
  • Identify and resolve problems and provide quick work-around solutions (when required) to key corporate business systems.

\xa0

The organisation:

\xa0

Stadiums Queensland (SQ) is a statutory authority which manages, operates and promotes the use of the State’s major sport, entertainment and recreation facilities including Suncorp Stadium, The Gabba, Sleeman Sports Complex, Brisbane Entertainment Centre, Queensland Sport and Athletics Centre, 1300SMILES Stadium, Cbus Super Stadium, Queensland Tennis Centre and Metricon Stadium.

\xa0

SQ’s diverse portfolio spans across elite and community facilities, hosting performances from international acts and entertainment, State, National and International sporting fixtures.

\xa0

Please visit the Stadiums Queensland Careers page, for the full position description and details on the application process.

Senior Administration Officer

Company Name The Australian National University Company Location Canberra, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Classification: ANU Officer Grade 6/7 (Administration)
Salary Package: $78,956 - $91,157 per annum plus 17% superannuation
Terms: Full time, Fixed term, (3 years, with the possibility of extension)


The ANU Biological Data Science Institute (BDSI) is a new academic unit in the Joint Colleges of Science that sits at the interface of data science and biological science. It aims to recruit, build and coordinate expertise in biological data science to accelerate the translation of biological data to biological knowledge. Operating in the space between traditional disciplines, the BDSI is positioned to collaborate widely across the ANU campus and with partner organisations to solve problems that have impact. This is a new Institute at the ANU, with an initial funding period of three (3) years.


Position overview


The Senior Administration Officer reports to the Director, BDSI, and will work closely with staff within the Institute, along with liaising closely with students, the Joint Colleges of Science Administration, the College Dean and General Manager, the Deputy Dean (Education), Research Schools across the University, and external partners such as CSIRO and ACT Health.


You will provide high-level, comprehensive administrative support to the ANU Biological Data Science Institute (BDSI) and assist the Institute Director with the business planning and projects, including the preparation of operational plans and briefings, and will provide advice on policies and procedures to support the achievement of strategic goals. In the immediate term, you will be the driving force in the setting up of the Institute, finding solutions and creating new pathways. The solution-finding element of the role will continue throughout the three year term as the Institution's capacity grows and new projects are adopted.


Applications are invited from individuals with demonstrated experience in a fast-paced operational and/or administrative focused environment. Experience in a tertiary institution will be highly regarded. The successful candidate will be able to evidence their exceptional organisational skills; will have high-level customer service skills; and will be able to use initiative and good judgement in decision-making. They will have a proven ability to quickly and efficiently, build strong and effective stakeholder relationships.


For more information please contact: Ms Nancy Richardson, Executive Officer, Joint Colleges of Science T: +61 2 6125 9515, E: Nancy.Richardson@anu.edu.au


ANU values diversity and inclusion and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to those of all backgrounds and identities. For more information about staff equity at ANU, visit https://services.anu.edu.au/human-resources/respect-inclusion


Application information


In order to apply for this role please make sure that you upload the following documents:


  • A statement addressing the selection criteria.
  • A current curriculum vitae (CV) which includes the names and contact details of at least three referees (preferably including a current or previous supervisor). If your CV does not include referees you can complete these online when prompted in the application form.


Applications which do not address the selection criteria may not be considered for the position.


Please note: The successful applicant must have the rights to live and work in this country.

  • Fostering the development of new, creative products and services
  • Improving the efficiency of the sales and tendering processes
  • Onsite technical support, problem solving and service appraisals
  • Operate as a fully functioning and actively contributing member of the Mechanical Sales Team
  • Able to convey customer requirements and conduct effective sales handovers to operations team

\xa0\xa0

Measurements:

  • Sales input
  • Gross margin
  • Market share
  • Key Account Plans
  • New Customers and/or service offerings

\xa0

Job Knowledge / Education and Qualifications

\xa0

Education and/or Experience:

Previous technical sales experience, ideally with pumps and associated equipment, with proven ability to demonstrate identification of opportunities, formulation of strategies and achievement of results. Trade Qualification in fitting/machining or equivalent metal trade.

\xa0

Language Skills:

Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals and technical procedures.\xa0 Ability to write reports and business correspondence.\xa0 Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.

\xa0

Reasoning Ability:

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

\xa0

Computer Skills:

Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office Suite, SAP and CRM.

\xa0

Physical Demands:

Car driving: For up to 7 hours per day

Travelling: On aircrafts, boats and to remote areas

\xa0

Work Environment:

Moderate office environment with regular exposure to loud mine/industrial sites. Appropriate PPE should be worn in site and workshop environments.


Desired Skills and Experience

  • Previous technical sales experience, ideally with pumps and associated equipment, with proven ability to demonstrate identification of opportunities, formulation of strategies and achievement of results.
  • Trade Qualification in fitting/machining or equivalent metal trade.
  • Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office Suite, SAP and CRM.

UX/UI Designer

Company Name The NRMA Company Location Sydney Olympic Park, Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


NRMA is well known for 98 years of Roadside Assistance. As Australia's largest Member organisation, The National Roads & Motorists' Association (NRMA) provides a range of services for our Members and the community. We are growing and transforming, as demonstrated by our Blue Highways strategy and the recent purchase of Manly Fast Ferry, as well as our work with electric and autonomous vehicles.


We are looking for a UX/UI Designer to join our team. Whilst we need someone who is competent in all facets of the design process (UX, UI, IA, IxD), we need someone who is especially passionate about Interaction Design. In this role, you'll tackle complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for millions of people around Australia-from the first-time user to the sophisticated expert.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
  • Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
  • Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
  • Build page navigation buttons and search fields
  • Develop UI mock-ups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
  • Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
  • Create and revise information architecture documents and diagrams including but not limited to: content diagrams, content maps, wire frame diagrams, comprehensive diagrams and static prototypes
  • Researching and analysing industry UX/UI trends and competitor sites and strategies
  • Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders




Essential

  • A well-rounded UX/UI professional who connects the dots between business needs, innovation and good design.
  • Experienced at driving a user experience from start-to-finish that delivers results, connects emotionally
  • Obsessed with good user-centred design practices and have an eye for detail.
  • Experienced at creating and revising information architecture documents and diagrams including but not limited to: content diagrams, content maps, wire frame diagrams, comprehensive diagrams and static prototypes.
  • Passionate about understanding (and keeping the team and stakeholders informed about) current and emerging UX/UI trends
  • Fluent in responsive design, mobile/tablet UI UX
  • 3- 5 years of UX design experience (and the portfolio to prove it) as a key, hands-on interaction/visual designer of a UI/UX team through the product development cycle of successfully launched web, mobile, and/or software applications.




Desirable

  • Familiar with HTML, JavaScript, and CSS design capabilities
  • Advanced degree or equivalent experience in Human Computer Interaction, Digital Media Design, Fine Arts or related field is desired.
  • Impeccable skills visual and motion design preferred




If you have the above skills and are looking for an exciting and rewarding career and has experience in shared services please apply today. We look forward to hearing from you.


We are proudly diverse and are committed to fostering an inclusive culture where all people are valued, respected and able to contribute their talents to drive organisational performance. We encourage applications from people from diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
